content.description: This is a one move wonder starting on two small holds, making a move to the lip, and then finishing on the slab all the way to the top.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the overhang on the south face.

content.description: Start in the scoop on the eastern side of the boulder, and climb up on vertical rib to pockets and up. There are some rocks in the landing zone.
Start on a crimp and a good right hand pocket, and go up using small but good crimps and top out on the slab.
content.location: This is the leftmost route of the overhanging east face.

content.description: Climb the diagonaling ramp system on the east face and top out super high on pretty steep rock.
content.location:
This is just around the corner from

Angler

on the left side of the east face.

content.description: Start sitting with a left hand on a seemingly chipped hold and right hand in an undercling pocket. Go pretty much straight up on decent holds. The crux is down low.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the south face.

content.description: Start on far left side, moving right, and end at the tree with a interesting mantel.
content.location: This traverses the long overhang on the West Block.

content.description: This is a fun highball that incorporates a high traverse to a flake. The traverse itself provides not much in the way of footholds, but there's a tree shadowing the traverse, which can be used as an exit, if the highball factor makes you change your mind.
content.location:
The route starts to the right of the rightmost tree on the east facing west block, next to

Angler

. Work your way up the pockets till good handholds seem to diminish. Traverse left under a tree till you reach the bulging flake. Use the flake to advance to the topout. From there, you can enjoy the view. Then walk down the other side of the boulder.

content.description: Start standing in the middle of the West face to the right of the bulbous hold on small crimps. Climb straight up the tall face. The holds get worse the higher you get.
Sit start on underclings and move up and left into pockets. Pull moves over lip and climb easy terrain to top.
content.location: Under the large overhang on the South face of West Block.

content.description: Climb up the slab on the right side of the east face. It is really fun and definitely a highball.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the south face, right of the tree.

content.description:
A nice tall problem on mostly good holds.

Start on the big block and move up into a couple of holds on a flake. Use some intermediates or make a long move up to a wide flat hold. Work right on this hold and make a long move up and right to just below the lip. Pull over the lip with some difficulty, this seemed more awkward than hard, though it is because the holds just don't seem to point the way you want them to.
content.protection: Pads and spotter, the problem is kind of tall and the top out is not easy.
content.location: This starts from the obvious block at about head height just to the left of center on the main face.
